intro: Ornithocephalus cruegeri, commonly known as the Crueger's ghostflower, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of small, white or pale pink flowers. Native to the arid regions of South Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of its family, while its stems are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its rarity and distinctive appearance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
